definitions.definition: (often used with the preposition "up") To lay or throw into a pile or heap; to heap up; to collect into a mass; to accumulate
definitions.example: They were piling up wood on the wheelbarrow.

definitions.definition: To cover with heaps; or in great abundance; to fill or overfill; to load.
definitions.example: We piled the camel with our loads.

definitions.definition: To add something to a great number.
To place (guns, muskets, etc.) together in threes so that they can stand upright, supporting each other.
To drive piles into; to fill with piles; to strengthen with piles.
To give a pile to; to make shaggy.
(iron manufacturing) Formed from a pile or fagot.
Having a pile or point; pointed.
